title: Sean Dyche slams Chelsea's Callum Hudson-Odoi in latest diving rant
text:
Callum Hudson-Odoi was booked for diving on Saturday night (Picture: AFP via Getty Images)

Sean Dyche has reignited his war on diving and slammed Chelsea’s Callum Hudson-Odoi after the teenager was booked for simulation against Burnley on Saturday night.

Hudson-Odoi came on as a substitute in the 4-2 win over the Clarets and initially saw a penalty given in his favour after he appeared to be felled in the area.

However, after a VAR check, referee Michael Oliver changed his decision and showed the England international a yellow card for diving.

Dyche didn’t name the Chelsea man in his post-match interviews, but clearly had that very situation on his mind as he bemoaned diving in the sport.

‘The only gripe I had with the game is that I can’t stand diving, it’s ridiculous,’ said Dyche. ‘We had a Premier League meeting at the beginning of the season and the worst they can get is a yellow card.

‘How’s that going to stop it? That ain’t going to stop it.

Sean Dyche absolutely hates diving (Picture: AMA/Getty Images)

‘It’s not a reflection of the game or the scoreline, Chelsea were too good for us tonight.

‘That’s got to go out of the game. It’s ridiculous now. Young players, young players diving, I just can’t stand it.

‘It’s shambolic how people dive about the place, I keep hearing the word respect, and I get shot down for saying this, I sit there amazed – respect the game. That is what people should be doing.’

This is not the first time Dyche has decried the curse of diving in the Premier League, as he was also unimpressed with the actions of Arsenal players in August.

‘It’s not encouraging for the game of football, I’m really worried for the game of football,’ the Clarets boss said after his side were beaten by the Gunners.

‘People diving all over the place today – it has to go.

‘I was at a Premier League meeting actually and it was brought up.

‘Did you know the maximum you can get for a dive is a yellow card? So for every player in the Premier League they can cheat at least once a game and get nothing other than a yellow.

‘I don’t think it will stop, do you? It’s not likely to stop.’
